definition:
A system is said to be encoded when a signal in the form of a code is used to decide the fate of items or boxes. In broader terms, it refers to systems that use codes to transfer instructions. Codes can be a Binary signal, a Hexadecimal signal or, less often, octal or quaternary, with either multiple or single digits.

## Note
There is a separate encoded storage development community/discord called [Soontech](https://soontech.org).
